snippet: Britain is debating a vast expansion of eavesdropping that would bypass judicial warrants. Such sweeping powers would compromise the privacy and liberty of law-abiding citizens.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the British government for its plan to implement sweeping new legislation that would expand the use of eavesdropping without warrants; asserts that such powers will compromise the privacy and liberty of law-abiding citizens.
lead_paragraph: Britain is debating a vast expansion of eavesdropping that would bypass judicial warrants. Such sweeping powers would compromise the privacy and liberty of law-abiding citizens.

headline.seo: From the Birthplace of Big Brother
headline.main: From the Birthplace of Big Brother
headline.print_headline: From the Birthplace of Big Brother
